column1: Annotation for each of the fields in the event_pages table - provides site specific parameters for the web scraper

column3: Link to web page were events are listed e.g. .../whatson/
Name of the website
Link to website logo
Root web page were events are listed e.g. ....com/
use ‘no’ if events have multiple addresses, otherwise provide address to be used for this webpage
alternative address if not found via address_sniffer method
if events are listed in specific container, leave blank if not
if events container provided/needed, enter container attribute name here
enter search string that will be used to identify links (hrefs) to events
either ‘search’ : search for keyword in links or ‘direct’: directly targeting a specific task
events url are either listed with relative (to event link or root) or absolute paths i.e. options: relative, relative_root, absolute
get title from specific single ‘tag’, from multiple ‘tags’, from ‘tag_attr’ tag/attribute combination or ‘tags_attr’ multiple tags/attribute (provide split delim) or ‘meta’ tag
if title container provided/needed, enter container attribute name here
name of tag - for title
type of attribute (e.g. class/id) - for title
name of attribute - for title
int to select the item of split list (zero indexed) if multiple items (use -999 if no split) - for title
get date from ‘tag_attr’ tag/attribute combination or ‘tags_attr’ multiple tags/attribute (provide split delim)
name of tag - for date
type of attribute (e.g. class/id) - for date
name of attribute - for date
comma separated list of ints to select the item of split list (zero indexed) if multiple items (use -999 if no split) - for date
delimiters used to separate dates
symbols used to connect dates
this will always be displayed with a star to give date info (e.g. NT always has multiple dates on page)

if column ‘address’ is not ‘no’ then get address from specific single ‘tag’, from multiple ‘tags’, from ‘tag_attr’ tag/attribute combination or ‘tags_attr’ multiple tags/attribute (provide split delim) or ‘meta’ tag
if address container provided/needed, enter container attribute name here
name of tag - for address
type of attribute (e.g. class/id) - for address
name of attribute - for address
int to select the item of split list (zero indexed) if multiple items (use -999 if no split) - for address
same as above for alternative address if first attempt comes back empty, original used again if no alternative loc known, needed to cover if nothing found on first attempt and alt is triggered
same as above for alternative address if first attempt comes back empty, original used again if no alternative loc known, needed to cover if nothing found on first attempt and alt is triggered
